During the review of paperwork and records it was noted that the acquisition records were incomplete. All of the required
information for whom the animals were purchased from or otherwise acquired was unavailable at the time of inspection.
Appropriate documentation of acquired regulated animals, and complete and accurate records of disposition are essential
for proper identification and necessary to track animals used in regulated activities to ensure their humane care, use, and
disposition.
Every dealer shall make, keep, and maintain records of acquisition and disposition for all regulated animals, including
animals born on the premises, and assure that all records are kept as required. To be corrected by the next pre-license
inspection.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspections or by November 7, 2023, or the applicant will forfeit the license
fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
